meanings.definition: The quality or state of being bathetic.
meanings.sent1: The bathoses of the movie made it hard to take the serious scenes seriously.
meanings.sent2: The bathoses in the novel's ending left the readers feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The bathoses in the play's climax made the audience chuckle unintentionally.
meanings.sent4: The bathoses of the speech brought an unexpected wave of laughter from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The bathoses of the painting's attempt at deep emotion was evident to all who viewed it.

meanings.sent1: The movie's sudden shift to comedy was a bathoses that confused the audience.
meanings.sent2: The bathoses in the story's plot twist felt out of place and forced.
meanings.sent3: The bathoses of the character's dramatic monologue turned into a comedy routine.
meanings.sent4: The bathoses of the situation made everyone burst into laughter unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The bathoses of the play's tragic moment was met with awkward giggles from the audience.
